subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Remapping Jerome
msgSnippet: I m almost finished with my proposal.  I do make use of doubling sometimes (Ewout) and J a lot (Paige)  I ll probably be able to post it tonight. SylOm v tOvy
messageBody:
I'm almost finished with my proposal.  I do make use of doubling sometimes (Ewout) and J a lot (Paige)  I'll probably be able to post it tonight.
 
SylOm v'tOvy
Shalom v'Tovah,
 
Jon  
http://surf.to/frimmin
 
It is more necessary to love much than to think much;
always do that which impels you most to love.
 
        --St. Teresa of Avila, The Interior Castle
----- Original Message -----
From: "Ewout Stam" <teraiten@...>
To: <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, March 09, 2002 5:53 AM
Subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Remapping Jerome

> Another good idea might be letter doubling.
> zz >
Z
> ss > S
> aa > y
> oo > Y
>
>
Ewout
>
>
> -----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
> Van:
Jon Zuck <frimmin@...>
> Aan:
Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com <Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com>
> Datum: zaterdag 9 maart 2002 1:43
> Onderwerp: Re:
[Read_Alphabet] Remapping Jerome
>
>
> >Hi,
Paige!
> >
> >I haven't forgotten my promise to try to come up
with a scheme, but haven't
> >been able to get around to it yet. 
Glad to see you're working on it.
> >
> >It appears to me that
you intend to the DFJK keys to act like the shift
> key,
> >to be
depressed and held down while the vowel key on the opposite hand is
> >struck.  It certainly would make more sense to have a "SHIFTy"
function
> >performed by index fingers instead of the poor little
pinky, so that is
> >definitely a noble idea.
> >
> >Unfortunately, <sigh> it won't work.  The problem is this: D
sometimes
> wants
> >to be held down and modify a vowel (without
triggering the repeat character
> >function), and sometimes it wants to
just be a Deed.  The same goes for
> FJK,
> >which also have
their logical, normal consonantal function still mapped to
> >them.  I don't have intimate knowledge of keyboard drivers, but
something
> >(still another key--ugh) would need to flag the computer
to say hey, I'm
> not
> >really a D, I'm a modifier, or else
Deed, Fife,  Judge, and Kick would need
> >to be remapped to far
less logical keys.  Neither seems desireable to me.
> >
> >
> >Shalom v'Tovah,
> >
> >Jon
> >http://surf.to/frimmin
> >
> >It is more necessary to love
much than to think much;
> >always do that which impels you most to
love.
> >
> >        --St.
Teresa of Avila, The Interior Castle
>
>
>

(Ewout) and J a lot (Paige)  I'll probably be able to post it tonight.

Syl=
Om v'tOvy
Shalom v'Tovah,

Jon  
http://surf.to/frimmin
